alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 26 at 2:37PM AKST until January 28 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible from Glennallen to Paxson. Total snow accumulation of 12 to 24 inches possible for the southern Copper River Basin, including Chitina to McCarthy. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A series of storms will track from the Gulf of Alaska north into Southcentral. The first storm for tonight into Saturday is tracking farther east, which will lead to lighter snow across the Copper River Basin. Thus, the threat for heavy snow has been pushed back to Saturday evening as the second storm arrives. There is still quite a bit of uncertainty with the track of this storm, but it currently favors the southern Copper River Basin for the heaviest snow, with somewhat lighter accumulation from Glennallen northward to Paxson. Additional storm systems and potential for more snow will follow through early next week.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
